quizQuestions.question: When you get a difficult problem in life or studies, what do you usually do first?
options: Break it into smaller, simple steps and solve one by one
Think of many creative and different ideas
Talk to someone and discuss it together
Search online or in books to see how others solved it

quizQuestions.question: You feel most happy and full of energy when you are:
options: Working on something technical (like computers, math, science experiments)
Creating something (like drawing, design, videos, writing, music)
Leading or guiding a group of people
Helping someone understand or solve a problem

quizQuestions.question: Your ideal study or work environment would be:
options: Quiet and focused, so you can concentrate deeply
Active and social, with people talking and sharing ideas
Fast and exciting, where many new things happen
Neat and well-organized, with clear rules and plans

quizQuestions.question: When you have to learn something new for school, you prefer to:
options: Read notes, books or websites carefully
Watch videos or visual explanations
Try it yourself by doing practical work
Ask a teacher, senior, or friend to explain

quizQuestions.question: You feel proud of yourself the most when:
options: You solve a tough logical or technical question
You create something that looks or sounds very good
Someone says you helped them or guided them well
You achieve a clear goal or target you planned

quizQuestions.question: In school or group projects, you usually like to:
options: Take charge, divide work and keep track of progress
Think of new, unique ideas for the project
Do the main technical or detailed work
Support others, encourage them and keep the group together

quizQuestions.question: Which type of activity feels most natural to you?
options: Using logic, numbers, and analysis
Using imagination, design, or artistic skills
Communicating, convincing or presenting
Planning, organizing, and managing tasks

quizQuestions.question: Which school subjects do you usually enjoy the most?
options: Math, Physics, Computer, or other science subjects
Art, Drawing, English, or other language subjects
History, Social Science, or Political Science
Business, Economics, or Accountancy

quizQuestions.question: When you have to make an important decision (like choosing a stream or course), you mostly depend on:
options: Facts, data, and information you collect
Your inner feeling and what excites you
Advice and opinions from family or friends
Past experiences and what worked earlier

quizQuestions.question: When you feel stressed about exams or future career, what helps you the most?
options: Making a timetable or clear step-by-step plan
Taking a creative break (music, drawing, games, etc.)
Talking to someone you trust
Quietly thinking and working through it one by one

quizQuestions.question: You feel you are naturally good at:
options: Understanding how systems, machines, or computers work
Expressing ideas through art, design, writing, or media
Talking to people, building relationships, or teamwork
Managing time, tasks, and responsibilities carefully

quizQuestions.question: If you imagine your dream job, it should allow you to:
options: Build or work with technology (apps, websites, machines, AI, etc.)
Create content (videos, designs, stories, music, graphics)
Guide people (as a leader, teacher, manager, counselor)
Use data, numbers, or research to make smart decisions

quizQuestions.question: What type of feedback helps you improve the most?
options: Straightforward feedback that clearly says what is wrong or right
Motivating and kind feedback that gives you confidence
Feedback with clear examples or stories
Feedback with scores, numbers, or visible results

quizQuestions.question: Outside school, you enjoy spending time on:
options: Coding, technical experiments, puzzles, or gadgets
Drawing, editing videos, photography, or music
Volunteering, teaching juniors, or working with people
Planning events, handling money, or organizing things

options: Being very strong in technology or problem solving
Being very creative and original in your work
Being a good leader or someone who inspires others
